NA Go to a state university if you know whats good for you !
NA I asked a Devry ECT advisor in Pomona CA why Devry was called a University .
NA He gave me a dictionary and asked me to look it up .
NA So I looked up 'University' .
NA I understand the definition but he didn't answer my question .
NA Why is Devry called a university ?
NA Who grants the accreditation and which accreditation are the most important ?
NA I wanted a side by side comparison but the advisor just shut me out .
NA If you're young , you have the time to go to a four year college .
NA Do that instead .
NA It's cheaper and classes won't be cancelled because no one enrolled but you .
NA I wish I've known this ; I came from a foreign country and thought this was a good 'shortcut' .
NA By shortcut I'm mean learning only the stuff you need to know for your major .
NA Devry , Keller , Phoenix or some Tech schools keep calling me but I pay no attention to them .
NA It's a good thing I supplemented my Devry degree with classes from a neighboring community college , mainly math classes .
NA By the way , if you pay for a service , you are a customer .
NA Because of that you should demand your money's worth .
NA Don't let them treat you like a student ; you're a customer before you're a student .
NA At the beginning of my enrollment , I signed papers relieving me of my ability to manage my account .
NA I was thinking , cool they can manage it for me .
NA But that isn't the truth .
NA They will charge you for stuff that no one really knows about .
NA I asked several employees why they were charging tech fee ?
NA They couldn't answer my question .
NA I took it up with the accountant , he said it was out of his hands .
NA He said they have to change it in Chicago where the headquaters is located .
NA I'm taking an online accounting course from home and youre charging me tech fee ?
NA It doesn't make sense to me .
NA The Devry accounting system looks like 1960's print out .
NA Who the hell use's that system ?
NA More problems :
NA They couldn't get my name right , my personal info was never updated , I still get forwarded mail from my previous addresses which are a month late .
NA The community college I go to isn't much better in the way of equipment but I believe the USA is really suffering from lack of money for the school system .
NA Education should never be for sale in the first place .
NA Whatever you do , don't start at Devry .
NA Go to night school at the local community college .
NA Ouch ! Some pretty harsh comments posted here , not all unwarranted .
NA As a current student UMUC-Europe , I can confirm that not all comments posted here are loaded , but I must say , many are .
NA Does anyone really buy that the Director is posting “student's names , social security account numbers , and addresses on the World Wide Web” .
NA If you do , try checking that claim .
NA I doubt you’ll find much to back it up ; I tried and failed .
NA But , as I mentioned , many claims posted here have sustenance .

NA Sometimes , the books assigned to a course are sub par ( and I stress SOMTIMES ) , grades for some courses come in slowly ( really annoying ) , and “in-class” courses get canceled often ( in Europe ) .
NA But some of these issues are very easily explained ( even justified ) if one takes the time to think about , as one post asked , “what is UMUC doing in Europe” ?
NA Well , they are there serving the military community with scattered all about Europe and the Middle East .
NA You see , UMUC has a contract with the Department of Defense to educate the military community stationed overseas .
NA Someone has to provide for the education of military members and their families while stationed overseas .
NA It is the Department of Defense that dictates what kind of programs can be offered to their community overseas .
NA In fact , it is the DOD that pretty much runs the show .

NA Now , To conduct an in-class course ( Face-to-face ) , there has to be enough people registered in that class to carry it on , and if there is not , well , the class gets canceled and field representatives try to encourage students to take distance learning courses ( that never get canceled ) in lieu .

NA With bases closing , and more and more of our soldiers being deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan etc . . ( and their wives and children going back to the States ) , enrollment ( in-class ) is falling and classes are being canceled .
NA I also here a lot of complaints directed at the faculty and staff at UMUC-ED .

NA Just a short insider bit of info I got from a friend that works there : UMUC-Europe employees get paid roughly half of what their counterparts in the states get paid AND , given that they are much less resourced , do twice the work .
NA I would assume that is a factor in their oftentimes less-than-sunny dispositions .

NA To put in my two cents of the University , I’ll say this : I have done my research , and for what it is ( an institution catering to the military community , ..and think about what that means ) , UMUC does a great job providing education for military members stationed overseas .

NA Yes , things could be done better , but I guarantee that it is the BEST University with a home-base overseas if only for it’s broad range of programs ( in comparison ) , it’s quality of education , and it’s flexibility .
NA I graduated with a B.S . from a great University in the States , so I like to think I know what good instruction is .
NA UMUC-ED may not live up to my previous institutions academic standards , but you know what , I think to think that you get what you give .
NA Just a few cents from a UMUC-ED student .
NA I just received my MIS in IT Management and I have to say I feel that I accomplished something of personal significance .
NA Yet , as with any academic institution , there are pros and cons .
NA My experience :
NA The Pros : the course sequence in my masters was well-planned .

NA By the last class , I had a new vocabulary and pretty much the rudiments of a new skill set ( I work in education and had little background in information systems , yet I was able to get up to speed relatively quickly ) .
NA Most of my fellow program students were sincere , smart , hard working people .
NA Every now and then , someone would flake out , but this was usually do to things going on in their work/personal lives .
NA And having worked on professional teams in non-academia , I have not found it to be much differrent .
NA I would say about 4/5 teachers were competent professionals and hard-working teachers .
NA That is pretty good for any school in my opinion .
NA The Cons : The weekly assignments require rigid discipline .
NA We all had day jobs in the MIS program , and coming home after 10+ hours to spend 1-2 hours writing discussion question answers was not what I would have preferred .
NA But that's the discipline you accept if you want an advanced degree while you're working .
NA One or two of my courses were just lousy ( Programming and Project Management--yet I got an A and a B+ respectively , so I'm not saying this out of misplaced resentment ) .
NA Overall : I think it's worth the money .
NA But as the wise man said : " Garbage in / garbage out . "
NA I graduated from Devry , and my two cents about it .
NA I work in the field as a software engineer ; graduated in 2004 and have been employed since .

NA Likes : - On hands training ( a lot of lab work ) - Some very knowledgeable experts were my professors ( this matters because you learn best from those who have real world knowledge , and not just from an individual with a masters or phd and no real world experience ; and yes more of my professors had obtained their phds ) - very good guidance and counseling on what courses will be required and what courses mesh well with certain other courses taken during the semester Dislikes : - expensive as hell , at least for a tech school - the university has more of a business approach ; rather , than a campus to serve the students approach - too many units in one semester ( if you are on the accelerated program ) - you don't get the same atmosphere as other universities ie . parties , sports teams , or hot chicks ( lets face it hot girls don't want to become engineers ) From my experience during my attendance at DeVry , I noticed only two types of students ; those who want a piece of paper that states they are engineers , and those who actually strive at becoming engineers because they know their future livelihood will depend on it .
NA Therefore , if you are the sooner rather than the latter then go to a JC and save yourself a lot of money .
NA Also , you can tell which students just wanted a hand me down diploma ; because they would always drop out during their later semesters and the lucky ones who managed cheated their way through .
NA p.s . I didn't cheat : ) my 3.2 gpa is proof of that , not too good and not too bad
NA ACTUAL Rating 2.5 - An honest review from a graduate
NA Today is my last day of class with UOP Online and I will finally have my bachelors .
NA If you are cosidering attending UOP Online you should read this .
NA During my 5 year treck to obtain my degree , I have attended UOP Online and my local community college both at the school and some online classes .
NA First UOP has the online learning down pretty good compared to my local community college .
NA They no longer use outlook express ( which wasn't bad in the first place ) but now have an " ok " web interface .
NA The electronic books you are forced to purchase are way over priced and very hard to use effectively .
NA The quality of education you receive REALLY depends on what you put into it .
NA You can learn a lot from UOP Online if you put in the effort .
NA However , my big gripe is that if you don't put in the effort , you can still pass .
NA I was out of UOP Online for a year while I attended my local community college to save some money .
NA When I came back I just happened to get into a class with a lady that I had major problems with in previous classes .
NA She basically didn't do her work in the teams that UOP Online requires .
NA Well she was still up to her old tricks : " Sorry I'm so late on doing my work , my DSL was out " .
NA She is only a few classes away from graduating .
NA UOP Online puts 30% of your grade on team assignments .
NA These assignments are worthless past the first few classes .
NA After that all you learn is that too many people don't do their work and you are required to pick up the slack .
NA Trust me , I work in teams every day at work and these " team assignments " are nothing like the real world .
NA What they do teach you is just how stressed out you can get every couple of weeks .
NA The cost of the education is expensive .
NA However , on the other hand I would not have been able to complete my degree at all if I was forced to attend a brick and morter school because of my busy work schedule .
NA It took me nearly a year and a half to get 9 credits from my local community college because I couldn't fit their schedule into mine .
NA With UOP Online I work on my schedule which was the only reason I did it .
NA I never had real problems with the staff and they always did their jobs and always called back .
NA On the other hand I never felt that UOP cared about anything other than my checkbook .

NA My biggest problem with UOP is not the staff , quality of education or price , it is the fact that they have turned the degree that I have worked so hard for into an almost embarrassment for me to admit to .
NA Their years of spamming people and online ads on nearly every web site you vist have degraded the image of the University severely .
NA This site is full of disgruntled students and obvious UOP staff posting comments .
NA Anyone that would rate UOP Online with 5 stars is not being truthful .
NA On the other hand almost anyone that has legitmately attended the university and worked hard would not in good faith rate it a 1 .
NA My advise ?
NA If you are young and just out of high school go to a traditional university .
NA If you are like me ( 30 something ) and need a degree and some education , UOP Online ( or another online school ) could be for you .
NA But be careful with UOP Online , they have really given themselves a bad reputation and no amount of 5 start postings will make up for it .
NA At the end of the day , anyone considering Capella ( or any other school , for that matter ) will have to make his or her own choice .
NA I chose Capella and have no regrets whatsoever .
NA I am now in my sixth quarter in the O and M PhD program , and have completed my residency requirement .
NA I am getting a very high quality education and am receiving excellent support from faculty and administration alike .
NA Every complaint or issue I have had has been quickly resolved with a simple phone call or email .
NA But don't just take my word for it ; consider as many well-respected , objective sources of opinions as you can gets your hands on , and THEN form your own opinion .
NA Examples include regional accrediting bodies such as North Central ( http://www.ncahigherlearningcommission.org/ ) , the Sloan Consortium ( http://www.sloan-c.org/ ) ,
NA or Noel-Levitz ( http://www.noellevitz.com/ ) .

NA I don't know why this site seems to attract people who have sour grapes with respect to Capella , and I don't know what motivates them to pretend they are a better judge of academic excellence than those who make their living assessing the academic quality of insitutes of higher learning .
NA My advice is that you consider that they are entitled to their opinion , but that you do your homework in order to make an informed choice .
NA I am currently attending Western International University .
NA Western International University is a branch of University Of Phoenix Online .
NA I have been attending this university for 6 months now and have had a wonderful experience .
NA I attended Old Dominion University in Norfolk , VA , which is a great school , but it was extremely difficult to find time in my busy schedule to attend class .
NA It was a 25-minute drive , if you didn't hit traffic .
NA Finding parking was a challenge and I was tired all of the time .
NA Having a career and attending school full time is overwhelming .
NA I did not take the easy way out .
NA I just explored my options .
NA The option to go to school when I want while obtaining an accredited degree was unimaginable ; however , available .
NA Transferring from ODU to University of Phoenix Online was the best thing I have ever done .
NA It is very challenging .
NA One must have self-discipline to attend this university .
NA There is a lot of writing and researching involved .
NA It is not easy whatsoever ; however , it is convenient .
NA Regarding financial aid , enrollment , and academic counselors , there have been no issues .
NA Financial aid is something that you pretty much take care of yourself through the FAFSA website .
NA The financial aid counselors are just there for guidance .
NA My enrollment counselor explained the positives and negatives of the university .
NA She explained , " This is not for everyone " .
NA She was very honest and helpful .
NA She did not bribe me with her words as some have stated .
NA My academic counselor was too good .
NA Honestly , he called too much .
NA I felt like I couldn't keep up with him .
NA I'm sure that some of you have had bad experiences as with anyone , anywhere .
NA For example , department stores , car dealerships , airlines , etc .
NA Just because one employee misrepresents a company , doesn't mean you should bad mouth it .
NA Everyone deserves a second chance .
NA I'm currently attending the University of Phoenix and will be getting an Associates in Business this winter .
NA After reading many reviews I was unsure whether my degree would be worth anything .
NA However , I just obtained a well paying job and was asked no questions about my degree .
NA As for the classes and the quality of the content , I would say they are average .
NA You are basically doing home schooling .
NA Some instructors are good and some are bad .
NA I recently had an instructor in my biology class who was tough .
NA I couldn't get away with anything because she was a biology teacher for her local college .
NA All the labs for science are virtual as well as the math classes .
NA I do change academic counselors a lot .
NA But , so far that has not affected my education .
NA Yes , the time is flexible for classes , but you have to remember there are deadlines for assignments .
NA In addition , there is a strict attendance policy .
NA Every person has to post at least two time per week to meet attendance or be dropped from the class .
NA The worst part of the school is the instructors that just hand out A's .
NA No matter what I write I get an A . However , I think that even happens in traditional colleges .
NA I can recall my health teacher @ Mesa Community college teaching for 15 minutes then dismissing us .
NA She also gave us all A's without trying .
NA I would reccomend the school if you don't have time to go to a traditional school .
NA Online education is a blessing for us working adults with children or busy lives .
NA I know my grammar and writing is rambling but I just wanted to give a quick review to help in any decision making process .
NA Man for everyone satisfied you will find 10 POed about something .
NA I attend CTU and frankly I prefer it over brick and mortar BS .
NA In a B and M you have the class clowns , the ones that are there for social status and then those who ride the backs of others .
NA I have been there for some time and yes there is good and bad .
NA Where isn't there after all ?
NA I admit that when we get people that constantly say I'm confused I believe they belong in a B and M .
NA Another thing and I am sorry to say this .
NA I honestly wonder why some of the people are there even .
NA I mean seriously it is Unversity level grammar and professional based workmanship , not HS .
NA The thing about CTU that people do not understand is that their course are degree specfic .
NA Not a meld with emphassis on a subject .
NA It is true it is hard and challenging .
NA The instructors are there to help , but they will not give answers .
NA It is our job to figure and show we grasp the meaning of what we are supposed to be learning .
NA Can you do that on a paper with a multiple choice quiz ?
NA It is high impact and self paced learning , with that do not fall behind .
NA We utilize research tactics that we are left to explore and believe it or not the teachers learn from us .
NA They are true professionals in the field that they are teaching , not a tenderd professional student .
NA I did look into other schools and I choose CTU for my reasons , not because of someone elses thoughts .
NA If that was the case I would not buy dog food at Wal Mart .
NA An education is something that is earned from various walks of life .
NA Where you recieve that education is your choice .
NA I am not championing CTU , it is only one of many options .
NA If you can not work on your and commit do not attend an online campus .
NA Capella University suffers the same problems that all for-profit institutions have get the money !
NA Never mind if the University drops the ball ; it seems their policy is : never admit fault , because it is always the customers fault !
NA I tried Capella because I believed in online education , but given my experiences I would not recommend them .
NA In the time I have been there I have seen the names on the instructions list change often , and given what Capella pays the adjunct faculty I am surprised they put up with it .
NA It is sad when an institution is comprised of nearly 90% adjuncts .

NA Well we can see where Capellas priorities are I guess I would not mind paying a premium tuition rate if the institution was sponsoring research , but let us face it , Capella is a meat grinding machine get them in , spit them out !
NA From an academic point of view , the faculty is great for the most part .
NA However , from a business point of view , they are just like any other for-profit business masquerading as an education institution .
NA Perhaps I am cynical , but I am uncomfortable what I see coming out of the institution .
NA Just my two cents .
NA One of the worst things about Capella is that it doesn't integrate technology into its courses .
NA There are no Power Point slides , no telecourses , no video feeds or rental tapes , etc .
NA In fact , all you can expect to do at Capella is read and write ( in the traditional , visually unappealing , and very boring way ) .
NA There is actually very little teaching going on , except for what you are teaching yourself through your own efforts ( reading and writing ) .
NA You can expect to learn more from your fellow classmates than any instructor teaching at Capella .
NA At least that has been my experience and I have taken 6 classes with 6 different instructors .
NA Whatever you choose to write about in your discussion posts is fine .
NA There are no corrections in your thought process or interpretations because there is no teaching going on .
NA They make you use APA but it doesn't matter .
NA Why ?
NA Because if you get your grammar and punctuation wrong , no one bothers to correct it .
NA Again , there is no teaching going on .
NA I just don't understand why quality instruction can't be provided by a university with no actual campus and high tuition rates .
NA Can't somebody please summarize and highlight the important points in my text through , say for example , a slide presentation ?
NA How nice the staff and administration are is secondary to getting a proper and useful education .
NA Don't you think ?
NA I am 2/3's through my Masters program and find it very challenging but rewarding .
NA There is a tremendous amount of work between the DQ's , individual projects and team projects .
NA The simulations are great and other than one facilitator , I have been more than pleased .
NA I have never worked so hard , the classes are really condensed into 6 weeks , and the evaluation is tough .
NA Although the university requires participation 4 out of 7 , the facilitators require content that show intellegent analysis .
NA The individual projects , often based on simulations , are pertinent to the topic but require you to really think about handling situations .

opinions.term: require you to really think about

raw_words: NA The team is as good as you make it .

opinions.term: as good as you make it

raw_words: NA I have been in both good and bad .
NA Mostly , I have found them rewarding but I always assume it is MY project , so am never disappointed .
NA Only once did I complain to the facilitator - and I know for a fact the two individuals left on my team were penalized .
NA I aced the class - but I did the whole paper .
NA The materials are real world and relevant with significant opportunity to tie in your personal and work experiences .

NA I have enjoyed the people I have gone to class with and although I have taken some breaks due to my employment reimbursement program - I am still in touch with several of prior classmates from around the GLOBE !
NA It is what you make it .
NA You must be very disciplined .
NA As for financial aid , I have no experience with it .
NA As for guidance - I have made my own decisions as to when to take a break and when I changed my major .
NA This is my second semester attending Devry I think it is great..I am now able to take classes that I actually need .
NA It's not a waste of time..Everyone is always crying and complaining about the cost of the school.Every school is costly.I know it's going to be worth it in the end

NA I will be starting online classes through the University of Phoenix in just a week and I have to admit that I am very nervous after evrything that I have read , so I decided to do some research of my own .
NA My biggest concern was the way that employers would view my degree .
NA So I asked a career counsler at a former school that I attended .

NA ( a traditional school by the way ) and was told that many online degrees are considered useless by employers but certain schools like The University of Phoenix and a few others are just as respected as any other degree .
NA In fact they are becoming so popular that employers that dont consider aplicants with online degrees are having trouble finding employees .
NA But I have spoken to my financial aid counsler and she has been very helpful so far .
NA I was told by the Dean that there was too many A's in my classes .
NA He worried about accreditation .
NA Another who appeared to be unstable sent me 4 E-mails in the duration of a day with threats and told me what a lousy instructor I was .
NA I sent all the messages to the dean , he was absolutely useless and did nothing .
NA One night online all of these students ganged up on me about there grades .
NA Students dont usually .
NA I would not want to work for such a two-faced , deceptive organization again .
NA All they care about is money , not education .
NA For the time , effort , and threats it was not worth it to me .
NA This supposedly military friendly school scammed me .
NA CTU was extremely helpful at first and I enjoyed the classes while at the same time was challenged by them .
NA One complaint I have is that I was put into a program where I was not allowed to choose my classes .
NA I thought it would be easy , but have found just the opposite .
NA You might be surprised to find out that DeVry is not a push over .
NA I was enrolled at UOP for a single class and quickly realized it was a complete waste of time and money .
NA The group projects were unbelievable , the subject matter completely useless , and the instructor was less than helpful , not to mention 2yrs later I am still getting spam mail from UOP .
NA Unfortunately that completely useless class I took at UOP won't transfer to anything else .
NA I was just admitted to the Masters of Science in Management - Project Management program and my advisor was extremely helpful .
NA I know you can't please everyone , but I have had nothing but a pleasant experience .
NA The folks in the financial aid department were also extremely helpful .
NA The students at the Dayton , OH campus left little to be desired and had no ambition and some because it was too challenging for them .
NA The faculty in OH was great and so was the administration .
NA They were all very fair and very invloved with the student body and I am someone who got mostly B's and C's at first .

NA I am very intelligent when it comes to Mythology and even after I worked my ass off with 2 and 3 papers a week , I still only earned a C . : ) That was still my favorite class because of the challenge and I learned much more than I already had known...learning only one new thing is worth your money alone .
NA The Chicago/Schaumburg classes are great !
NA I have wonderful classmates that are actively involved , great instructors...for instance , one of my instructors had worked for NASA and one had worked for CIA several years before !
NA I have little good to say about the administration here in IL as opposed to OH , but that is the trade-off .
NA The Learning Team concept can be challenging , but very rewarding...it teaches you the concept of reality...the life of hard knocks .

NA The funny thing is that the people that work at this University in administration...that can't do their job right for anything(that means as easy as making a phone call ) went to traditional Universities ! ! ! !
NA UMUC's quality of education plummeted faster than Enron stock .
NA One reason was that UMUC's key administrators weren't paying attention .
NA There are numerous complaints lately that UMUC is tapping teachers to teach courses outside their area of expertise and without a credential in the assigned field .
NA As a student though we should know the competence and experience of the persons assigned to teach our classes .

NA UMUC is also taking flak because their teachers are older , out-of-touch with developments in their field of instruction , not representing the diversity of the student population UMUC serves and unable to find work at other colleges ( which is why they're at UMUC ) .
NA The administrators need to know why and how the wheels came off .
NA They also need to know how to get and keep good teachers and stop highly qualified teachers from leaving for more money and better working conditions .
NA Devry is very expensive , one of the most expensive schools of its kind .
NA An online degree takes dedication and self motivation .
NA Yes the advisors are sales persons , but guess what if it takes a sales person to get me off my ass to make an improvement in my life then go ahead .
NA " I AM A PROUD INTERNATIONAL CTU STUDENT " .
NA For most CTU is just another college they and jump from like a froh would a lilly pod .
NA I love CTU and will continue from there all the way to my masters .
NA The thing I like most about the school is that the teachers force students to conduct research and formulate their own opinions .
NA I love this school !
NA I am looking at many online universities , and JIU seems to have the best Ed.D program in leadership .
NA The admissions office has been helpful .
NA It may be more expensive , but I think my degree will be earned and not bought .
NA I can understand someone being upset and reporting or telling others , but some people have had a great experience at AIU , UOP , and other institutions that have bad comments on the site .
NA I am surprised that the school remains accredited .
NA As a CTU grad , I can say that CTU is on par with any traditional school in the country .
NA i just applied for devry university online and i am concerned with the entrance exam !
NA I did a lot of research before enrolling and UoP seemed to be the only thing that was going to work for me .
NA I , too was a little leery of UoP because of its reputation .
NA The more I searched , I realized that UoP was the only thing that was going to work with my current situation .
NA I figured that a degree from a school with a bad reputation is better than no degree at all , so I enrolled .
NA First of all , the enrollment counselors can be a little aggressive .
NA The first two classes were horrible .
NA For people who are not used to computers or Internet forums , these classes would be great .
NA I found them to be a waste of time and money .
NA My academic and financial advisers have only changed once and do a much better job than the first ones .
NA Anytime I have a question they are very quick to answer and try to help whenever they can .
NA One thing you must understand about this school is that no one will hold your hand and make sure you do your work .
NA There is a lot of reading material and sometimes the work can be more tedious than challenging .
NA Apollo group does have a bad reputation based on business practices but those practices have nothing to do with the quality of education offered by Axia or UoP .
NA I wouldn't rule UoP out for on-campus studies either .
NA I would recommend UoP to anyone who needs to get a degree from home .

NA This Is what I have to say about Phoenix University staff : Incompetent , I GOT IN in last year in September , applied for a loan and after the first class I decided to pay my school cash and ask the University to return my loan , Now after 8 Months I get phone calls and e-mail form the loan company . . . hearing that my loan was not returned jet and I still have to pay for my loan . . . .
NA To this point , the instructors have been engaged , providing significant feedback , and well qualified .
NA My fellow learners are intelligent , hardworking , and have plenty of real-world experience to share .
NA I am finding the experience very worthwhile and rigorous .
NA My experience at DeVry is by far one of the worst I've had .
NA DeVry's employee are lazy and incompetent .
NA Out of all the professor , I'd say two actually cared about the students' well-being . . and yes , they left the school already because they knew what a fraud the school has become .
NA I had a nightmare with Capella University .

NA As the president of the ASB at the Long Beach campus I have had very many mixed feelings when it comes to DeVry . . . Im a 7th term Computer Engineering Technology major and I really think that devry has kind of gone through alot of problems ever since their " hay-day " back in the mid-late ninties...for any prospective students , here is my pro/con list for you : //----------------------------- // // PROS // //----------------------------- ---small class sizes , on the average your classes will have between 6 - 15 students . . . usually on the smaller side .

NA that doesnt sound like much , but even if your professor sucks , at least hes only ten feet away rather than 400 in a lecture hall ---expedient education devry uses a trimester based system , which means that you only have 6 weeks off for the whole year ; however , you graduate in three if you take the standard course load of 17.68 units per tri ---abet/tac accreditation devry has had accreditation for a long time now and here at the long beach campus , abet tac gave us the longest accreditation that they offer .

NA ---job placement i had two friends last semester that graduated with 3.5 and 3.9 and both were offered engineering positions that offered their starting pay at 50k and 65k respectively there are tons of jobs for us CET's and EET's...that if you work hard in them your looking at 6-figure salaries within 10 years easily //----------------------------- // // CONS // //----------------------------- ---bad profs while almost every school has em....we seem to draw them like flies .

NA ive had well over half of my classes taught by completely ridiculous professors , some of which truly puzzled me as to how anyone in the world could actually hire this person ---incompetent administration sometimes i truly am amazed whenever i have to visit any of the various departments , particularly student finance .
NA the experience that i have when i visit student finance is much like going to the dentist , except when i leave , nothing is ever fixed , and i am always angrier than when i entered .
NA get rid of all the ridiculus programs that we have no facilities for ; namely the GSP , HMIT , BMET , BMI , etc.etc .
NA I'm in my second block of classes , and to be perfectly honest the classes are way way too easy .
NA Staff I would rate a 3/5 , they are courteous , but can take a long time to respond .
NA I am a student in the healthcare management program and it has proved at times to be very intense and difficult , Especially if you also work 50 , or for those who work 40 hours , or more a week .
NA Some have had good experiences and some have had bad , don't discount UOP if you don't know anything about it .
NA I have am half way through my second course with the UOP and I must say that it is well worth the extra money .
NA This has been the best experience , it allows me to work my full time job and maintain full time school status throughout the year .
NA Many of you complaining about DeVry and some of you even think it is a scam .
NA That is not true at all .
NA My experience at DeVry was one that I would not go through again if I had a second chance .

NA Here's a quick rundown of my experience : 1 ) I had no problem with financial aid , cuz I figured , if DeVry wanted its money they would do everything in their power to get me the loans and grants I needed to pay them . . . which they did .
NA 2 ) The majority of the classes in my particular field , Electronics Engineering Technology , were lacking competent , motivated professors .
NA There were professors I had who talked bad about DeVry during class , that's when I knew how big of a mistake it was to go to DeVry .
NA That's an upside to DeVry , if you pass all your classes you'll be out in 3 years or less , depending on your degree .
NA 3 ) I graduated DeVry Magna Cum Laude , which , if DeVry was tougher on their curriculum and not have professors who give easy As , I can say , I would never have gotten .
NA I've attended two state universities and a community college and none have compared to the excellence at Devry .
NA The education is worthless .
NA My experience at UOP has been quite rewarding both on a personal and professional level .

NA The majority of the instructors in the graduate business program were very good to excellent , however at any institution ( top ivy league institutions included ) there are bound to be a few bad apples and UOP is no exception .
NA Yes , the learning team environment has pros and cons , but what learning model is perfect ?
NA In some ways potential students can view this negatively and may give the appearance of lowering academic rigor and quality , which is not the case in the MBA program .
NA My graduate education at UOP has served me well thus far .
NA I have been an online student for two trimesters now and the professors were very good .
NA At first they seemed a little pompus , but as the trimester continued they were much more helpfull .
NA The insight coaches were also great .
NA The only problem I had was the fact that financial aid called every week of the trimester and still screwed my bill up .
NA It was easily corrected by my advisor , but it upset me greatly .
NA The school has a good name and from the instructors I had they deserve it . . .
NA I enjoyed the courses very much and learned a lot .
NA So far its been two very boring years of my life .
NA I like nothing about Devry actually .

NA I graduated from the University of Virginia ( UVA ) for my undergraduate degree , and the work at UOP was at least as hard as the work at UVA , which is one of the very top public schools in the nation .

NA UOP is NOT perfect - we had a couple professors that were not great ( most of our professors were very good , with relevant , current field experience ) , and my financial aid counselors DID change constantly .
NA Most of my classmates stayed together through the entire program , and they were great .
NA The best part of the program was learning from my classmates and professors through online discussion .
NA Very rich experiences from which to draw .

NA First let me say , some may think that UOP's credits are not transferrable , but to the contrary , the reason why some colleges refuses to accept the university's degree is simply out of intimidation .
NA Their motives are to simply discourage people from attending the UOP because traditional colleges are losing grounds to colleges such as the UOP .
NA As a matter of fact , many colleges/universities are now adopting to the UOP way of teaching by trying to make education more accommdating to working adults such as myself .
NA Now I may not be an online student , as I've attended all but one of my classes in a regular classroom setting , but I have had to take one class online and it was not easy .
NA As UOP was NOT the only college that I've attended , I can safely say that there were no differences between meeting my academic requirements between the universities .
NA The education system is top range BUT administration , IT and finance are quite messy though .
NA It's bad enough that we go through all sort of obstacles in life , now I see people downing my school .
NA I love CTU and it has to have thousands of people joining for a reason everyone isn't dumb .
NA I keep hearing " Yeah you should go " and " Nah , You shouldn't go its not a good school " .
NA I enjoyed most of the classes , except I had one professor who accused me , without proof and justification , of plagarism .
NA This was a mess .
NA My advisor was horrible , she told me what classes I needed and it turned out I did not need the classes .
NA I finally got a good advisor , but by that time my f.a . expired and I had to move on with around 5 course left to graduate .
NA On the plus side , the classes are easy becuase of the schedule and most of the professors are easy to communicate with .
NA I have to admit , I have learned twice as much in this school , with this set up and schedule , than in any other college .
NA I really think that the topic of UOP is 50-50 ; it goes both ways and there will never be a wrong or a right answer .
NA It is an opinion and I find it hard to believe that people who attended one class can bad mouth the school ( Some don't even make it through one class , they drop out 2 weeks into it ) .
NA To go and bad mouth the school based upon this situation is just wrong .
NA I loved all my experiences with this school and I am proud to say that I will be transferring over to the UOP bachelors in Business Management .
NA I am proud to tell you most of them drive expensive cars , what does that say ?

NA I have to tell you , if you are debating the school because of what someone else says , you should just give up all together ( would you jump off the cliff with them too ? ) It is expensive , but they work with you and they have always been great ( I got my financial aid with no problems at all ) .
NA I thank God for the creation of something so great for my education .
NA It really is a Blessing ! !
NA I took a few courses at Capella and found it to be a substandard experience .
NA Capella is nothing but a diploma mill .
NA After my poor experience with Capella University , I would not recommend it to anyone who desires a real education - find a traditional school for that .
NA I find the process challenging , the teachers good , and the courses expensive .
NA He is a very dedicated instructor and does his best to make sure his students understand the material .

NA He earned his Bachelor's degree from a very reputable liberal arts school with many accredidations and felt that CTU was equaly challenging with equal possetive and negative issues on the business side .
NA I recently transferred my credits to CTU , no problem , to complete my degree .
NA I feel I have been treated very well and my classes are in deed challenging .
NA This is no diploma mill .
NA This is a regionally accredited school with qualified instructors .
NA I have had some great educational experiences here at UMUC .
NA My main complaint with UMUC is the disorganization among their administration .
NA However , the people that do the admissions need lots of training .
NA They are very nice people until you deviate from what they want you to do .
NA Then they become abusive .
NA I haven't ever met a supervisor that would take the side of a badly behaving employee .
NA I think the school probably is a good one , but they need to come up with a different way to admit people .
NA It was extremely challenging and demanding .
NA The program has been challenging but fair , with great interaction .

NA UMUC Online and UMUC in Europe have a lot of problems with providing F2F and online education courses , judging from the many student ratings here , on thecomplaintstation , and from internal UMUC docs posted to UMUCDE@yahoogroups.com .
NA I'd say there's a lot of student disenchantment with UMUC courses and programs , and UMUC administration .
NA It looks like UMUC could use a housecleaner for ineffective workers , and get in touch with the students who have posted their suggestions .
NA All the low ratings of UMUC F2F courses , online programs , and administration in Europe have got to be hurting business .
NA I guess they deserve the low ratings .
NA I had a terrific experience with my Masters Program although some classes seemed too short .
NA I found it harder than going to classes from what I remember .
NA Lots of weekly assignments .

NA I don't think UOP should be deminish because of some people that think they're the smartest people on earth , nor for people that didn't appreciate the value of going to school and earn a bachelor's degree from the conform of the home with flexible schedule .

NA For those that don't like UOP , think the following : The next time you sit on a nice office making 50K or more because of the UOP degree you have stock on the wall , and 10% of what you do is what UOP gave you in education and 90% comes from the employer trainning , but your employer wouldn't hire you without that diploma you have on the wall , think again what your opinion of UOP will be .
NA This is the biggest reason I decided not to go to this school .
NA The reason why Capella falls short is because they ARE an online school .
NA Why should you be rewarded when you deliver a bad product ?
NA There is no doubt in my mind that an education from Capella is a high-quality one .
NA Every single course I took was challenging and educational ( I took four years worth of courses , having changed my focus throughout that time ) .
NA There is barely a time throughout each course in which you feel you can just slow down ; be thankful for your two-week break between each course !
NA I'll admit that before beginning my education at Capella , I did not think online learning would be that difficult ; in fact , I think I assumed it WOULD be easy .
NA Is everything perfect , all of the time ?
NA As far as quality education , they do not skimp .
NA Most instructors are very involved and available ; and you interact more with peers than what might be required in traditional brick and mortar .

NA I will say , I often did miss the physical interactions that a brick and mortar education offers ; and you do have to be prepared for the " silence " ( which , by the way , was maddening to me at first ) .
